intro: Sanguisorba magnolii subsp. goekhanii, commonly known as the Turkish rose of the mountains, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces reddish-brown seed capsules that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
